intro: Cnidium cenolophioides, commonly known as the Chinese snake herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to East Asia, particularly China, and thrives in moist, temperate environments. The plant features a slender, branched stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
